extendedIngredients.name: yellowtail snapper
extendedIngredients.original: 4 (6-ounce) yellowtail snapper or other firm white fish fillets
extendedIngredients.originalName: yellowtail snapper or other firm white fish fillets

title: Nut-crusted Yellowtail Snapper with Mango-Butter Sauce
summary: Nut-crusted Yellowtail Snapper with Mango-Butter Sauce might be just the main course you are searching for. For $5.12 per serving, this recipe covers 36% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 767 calories, 45g of protein, and 43g of fat. This recipe serves 4. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. A mixture of pepper, flour, macadamia nuts, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the panko you could follow this main course with the Panko Crusted Brownie Pie as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 78%, this dish is solid. Try Potato-Crusted Yellowtail Snapper, Blackened Yellowtail Snapper with Mango Salsa, and Macadamia Nut-Crusted Snapper With Mango Lime Butter for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chehalem 3 Vineyard Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: A blend of three great vineyards, this vivid grape crafts a food-friendly wine, bright and pure. Gray it isn't. The knife-edged acid, with pear, lemon sorbet, spice and jasmine makes your mouth water and your hands shake.

instructions: Pulse nuts in a food processor until finely ground. Add panko, and pulse until combined. Place mixture in a shallow bowl.                                                                                                Place flour in a shallow dish. Whisk egg in a medium bowl. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, shake off excess, and dip in egg. Dredge fish in nut mixture, coating completely.                                                                                                Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Add 2 fillets; cook 3 minutes on each side or until golden. (If nuts brown too quickly, reduce heat.) Repeat with remaining 2 tablespoons oil and fish. Divide rice and fish fillets among 4 serving plates. Top with Mango-Butter Sauce, and sprinkle with green onions.

steps.step: Pulse nuts in a food processor until finely ground.
Add panko, and pulse until combined.
Place mixture in a shallow bowl.
Place flour in a shallow dish.
Whisk egg in a medium bowl.
Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, shake off excess, and dip in egg. Dredge fish in nut mixture, coating completely.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat.

Add 2 fillets; cook 3 minutes on each side or until golden. (If nuts brown too quickly, reduce heat.) Repeat with remaining 2 tablespoons oil and fish. Divide rice and fish fillets among 4 serving plates. Top with Mango-Butter Sauce, and sprinkle with green onions.
